name: Callable - Add Salesforce Case fields to Jira Issue
description: When there is a trigger event, do action

code.name: receive_request
code.description: New call for Add Salesforce Case fields to Jira Issue

input.service_name: Add Salesforce Case fields to Jira Issue
input.request_schema_json: [{"control_type":"text","label":"Jira Issue Key","name":"jira_issue_key","type":"string","optional":false},{"control_type":"text","label":"Salesforce Case Number","name":"salesforce_case_number","type":"string","optional":true,"hint":"specify if you want to add the case number to the Jira (this recipes checks to make sure duplicates are not added)"},{"control_type":"text","label":"Salesforce Account Name","name":"salesforce_account_name","type":"string","optional":true,"hint":"specify if you would to add the account name to the Jira  (this recipes checks to make sure duplicates are not added)"}]
input.reply_schema_json: [{"name":"jira_issue_key","type":"string","optional":false,"hint":"Key of the updated Jira.  It will be blank if no matching Jira could be found.","control_type":"text"}]

properties.label: Salesforce Case Number
properties.name: salesforce_case_number
properties.hint: specify if you want to add the case number to the Jira (this recipes checks to make sure duplicates are not added)

properties.label: Salesforce Account Name
properties.name: salesforce_account_name
properties.hint: specify if you would to add the account name to the Jira  (this recipes checks to make sure duplicates are not added)

block.comment: Get the latest details of the specified Jira
throw an exception for all other errors
If the Jira is not found, stop the job and do not return jira_issue_key to notify calling recipe that no Jira could be found matching this key

input.stop_reason: Specified Jira could not be found.

block.comment: If we couldn't find (or don't have permissions to view) the Jira, then stop the job.

block.comment: ignore the error if the Support Link field is not available for this Issue

If the calling recipe wanted us to add the Case Number to the Jira, see if that field needs to be updated in Jira

block.comment: Ignore the error if the Customer field is not present for this issue
Add the Account Name to Customer field in Jira if it doesn't already exist.
If the calling recipe wanted us to add the Account Name to the Jira, see if that field needs to be updated in Jira
If the Resolution is NOT present, this means the Jira is still in progress and you can update the Jira fields

block.name: send_reply
block.description: Return response from Add Salesforce Case fields to Jira Issue

extended_input_schema.name: message
extended_input_schema.label: Message
extended_input_schema.hint: Error message

extended_input_schema.name: code
extended_input_schema.label: Error code
extended_input_schema.hint: Use this field to set custom HTTP error code for service replies. E.g: 404/422 etc. This field is applicable to REST service recipes.

extended_input_schema.name: custom_error_response
extended_input_schema.label: Custom error response?
extended_input_schema.hint: By default, Workato sends 'reply_type' and 'message' fields in response. When set to 'Yes', the content of the 'Message' field is sent as response body. This field is applicable to REST service recipes.

toggle_field.label: Custom error response?
toggle_field.hint: By default, Workato sends 'reply_type' and 'message' fields in response. When set to 'Yes', the content of the 'Message' field is sent as response body. This field is applicable to REST service recipes.
toggle_field.name: custom_error_response

block.comment: don't stop with error because we would want to fix this error from the parent recipe
If there was an error, return it

block.name: send_reply
block.description: Return response from Add Salesforce Case fields to Jira Issue

properties.label: Jira issue key
properties.name: jira_issue_key
properties.hint: Key of the updated Jira.  It will be blank if no matching Jira could be found.

code.comment: This recipes does the following:  Add the Case Number and Account Name to the Jira (if specified and if the Jira is not CLOSED).
